website_summaries.verdict: The Casio G'zOne Commando is absolutely the choice if you want a rugged Android smartphone, but you have to keep its various negatives in mind.
pros: The Casio G'zOne Commando is a durable and rugged handset that is also an Android smartphone
It has a great suite of applications for outdoor enthusiasts
Other notable features include Wi-Fi, mobile hot-spot capability for up to five devices, GPS, and high-security encryption for corporate e-mail
cons: The Casio G'zOne Commando is unfortunately saddled with bloatware from Verizon, and the default search engine is Bing
Google Maps is not preinstalled either, though you can download it yourself
Casio's snap-out menu is not as fluid as we would like
Photo quality is average, and call quality is a little muddy

customer_reviews.title: Tough as nails!!!
customer_reviews.text: I love this phone. I work as a Medicolegal Death Investigator for a Medical Examiner's office, and my phone has ended up in a swimming pool 3 times, a muddy ditch once, a pond and a creek. Able to retrieve it each time, and it still works perfectly. I just clean it off, dry it and put it back to use. I have the extended life battery on it so I can go at least 72 hours of standby and talking without having to recharge the battery. I will be buying another as a backup just in case the next time it goes in a pond, I can't find it. I cannot say anything bad about it.
customer_reviews.author: COUNTY CORONER

customer_reviews.title: HTC and Samsung smart phones and they are basically the same for settings
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this phone for my husband's first smartphone. He needed a rugged one, which the Casio certainly is. It is different that a standard Android phone. I have both LG, HTC and Samsung smart phones and they are basically the same for settings, etc. The Casio is not. On reboot it automatically turns on the data? Will keep it as a back up because I bought a refurbished phone and it's in excellent condition. Not for a first time smartphone.
customer_reviews.author: Rahna

customer_reviews.title: ... had g-zone phones for years and this is far superior than the previous versions
customer_reviews.text: I have had g-zone phones for years and this is far superior than the previous versions. I had lots of issues with the previous version calling people on its own -problem resolved with this one. The operating system is improved too. I needed a durable waterproof phone and this one doesn't disappoint. I have dropped it and soaked it countless times and it still works!
customer_reviews.author: Gary

customer_reviews.title: most durable, dependable phone ever
customer_reviews.text: This is the 3rd time I have purchased the same phone. They are tough, long lasting phones. The first one I purchased had to be replaced only after I left it on the hood of my Jeep and it was run over by a few hundred vehicles. And then the screen was cracked, but the phone still functioned. The 2nd one was lost. I hope that Casio makes an updated version soon. I would buy this phone again and again. Its definitely made for people that are hard on their phones like me.
customer_reviews.author: Jen

customer_reviews.title: Not worth it
customer_reviews.text: After trying to use this phone for one week, I had to send it back. The battery does not hold a charge, the back does not stay on well and the phone case designed to go with this phone does not have the option of a clip to attach to your belt. If you buy the case and buy the pouch with the clip, you cannot fit the cased phone into the pouch. The phone is heavy and bulky. After making one phone call that lasted 3 minutes, the battery went from full charge to 26% within 4 hours.
customer_reviews.author: One Eye

customer_reviews.title: This has been a great phone. I have had it for months now
customer_reviews.text: This has been a great phone. I have had it for months now, and no issues. Only complaint is that I am unable to update Android software, but that is a Verizon hook, to get you to replace your phone.
customer_reviews.author: John C

customer_reviews.title: Garbage
customer_reviews.text: Speaker doesn't work. I can hear people talking to me but they can't hear me if it's on speaker!!! Also if I put headphones in and put it in my pocket it hangs up.
customer_reviews.author: Delores p Smith

customer_reviews.title: The poor battery life kills its practicality.
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted this phone to work. I had the old c771 model, and it worked great. The C811 has a terrible battery life after only a couple of weeks. I tried the extended battery, replacing it with a Casio and OEM batteries, charging and fully discharging the lithium batteries, changing settings but nothing improved the battery life. It's a rugged cool looking phone. It's too bad the manufacturor couldn't design a better battery.
customer_reviews.author: Lance E Russell

customer_reviews.title: Didn't even last a week. Started to go in ...
customer_reviews.text: Didn't even last a week. Started to go in and out of apps without me touching the phone. Then a week after I bought it, it just died and never came back on. No problems with the seller.

customer_reviews.title: Most rugged phone I've ever had. This was a ...
customer_reviews.text: Most rugged phone I've ever had. This was a replacement phone, after 4 years of abuse my original was finally done. I work in a heavy industrial setting and needed a phone that could survive falls, dust, and being dropped in puddles. This one took them all and laughed. Hot sparks from welding finally did it in.

customer_reviews.title: Not Actually Waterproof!
customer_reviews.text: The phone worked well for 3 weeks with the exception of the atrocious battery life. However, I purchased this phone based on the premise that it was waterproof. As a avid fly fisherman I figured that this phone would fit the bill when took the inevitable misstep and pour some water down my waders. Well, one misstep and this phone got wet and was finished. I returned this phone and would not recommend if you are active and clumsy, such as myself.

Good thing I opened and checked it before giving it to her. And the phone is working SUPER SLOW. DO NOT BUY FROM THEM ITS A RIP OFF.

customer_reviews.title: this thing is great. it's a little old
customer_reviews.text: 2nd commando, i had the predecessor. I have broken a car window with this phone. i could probably beat down a mugger with it! I have dropped it in a river, i have climbed up and down ladders all day with this phone and a 3/4" wrench banging together. this thing is great. it's a little old, the software is better on my $29 zte, but you could smash like 30 zte's to pieces with this phone and keep on going. don't need a case, and it's definitely better than carrying something in an otterbox
customer_reviews.author: chihuly

customer_reviews.title: Everything worked except for the most important thing to me ...
customer_reviews.text: Everything worked except for the most important thing to me.....I can't talk to the person I call because the mic doesn't work.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

product_meta.title: Casio G'zOne Commando 4G LTE C811 Verizon Android Rugged Android Smart Phone (Latest Model)
product_meta.description: This is a Casio G'zOne Commando C811 phone for Verizon. The Casio Commando is known for its rugged durability while sporting a touch screen display. Operating on the Android OS, the Commando is water, shock, and dust resistant. Never get lost with the included GPS navigation and built in electronic compass. The Casio Commando has all the features of a smartphone while being tough. Network Type: CDMA
feature_bullets: Here is the easy way to fix some of the simple problem. Restore the phone first to see if this help. 1. Ensure the device is powered off. Note If screen is frozen, remove/reinsert battery. 2. Press the Power button (located on the top right edge) to power the device on. 3. When Now Loading displays on the device, press and hold the Power button (located on the top-right edge), the Volume Up button (located on the left edge near the top) and the Menu icon Menu icon (located on bottom-right) for 20-30 seconds. Note Device vibrates several times. 4. Release all buttons once the Android system recovery screen appears.. 5. When prompted with "Permanently Erase User Data and Reset Settings?", select "yes --- delete all user data." Note Utilize the Volume buttons to highlight and the Power button to select. 6. When prompted with "Are you sure you want to continue with erase?", select "Yes -- delete all user data". Note Allow several minutes for the factory data reset and reboot processes to complete.
